summary: Completed frontend performance testing for GuessIt Football Prediction Platform. Banner carousel fixes work perfectly with no layout shift, but Grid/List toggle has performance lag (~350ms instead of instant).

performance_issues.issue: Toggle switch takes 350ms instead of being instant
performance_issues.expected_behavior: Should be <50ms for instant CSS-based switching
performance_issues.current_behavior: Toggle works functionally but has visible lag

passed_tests: Banner carousel: Fixed height container (280px) with no layout shift
Banner carousel: Smooth opacity transitions between slides
Banner carousel: All 3 slides render correctly with content
Banner carousel: Navigation arrows work correctly
Banner carousel: Dot indicators work and reflect active slide
Grid/List toggle: Functional switching between layouts
Grid/List toggle: Match data preserved when switching (109 matches)
Grid/List toggle: Correct CSS classes applied (match-view-grid/match-view-list)
Grid/List toggle: Both views show correct match information
Homepage: Match cards render with live data from Football-Data.org API
Homepage: Header, tabs, league filters visible and functional
Homepage: Vote buttons clickable and functional
action_item_for_main_agent: Grid/List toggle has 350ms lag instead of being instant. The CSS-based switching implementation might still have JavaScript processing causing the delay. Consider optimizing the view mode change handler or CSS transitions.
